issue.subject: Applying organism's category to every easySDI objects
issue.description:
New access scope "Organism's category" has been developed (see https://forge.easysdi.org/issues/642) but haven't been applied to all easySDI objects.

Such objects should be setted up and implemented as well:
* layer (MAP) in backoffice
* perimeter (SHOP) in backoffice
* property (SHOP) in backoffice

Such objects should be implemented as they can already be setted up
* visualization (MAP) in frontoffice
* diffusion (CATALOG) in frontoffice

I hope other easySDI objects haven't been forgotten...

details.name: description
details.old_value:
New access scope "Organism's category" has been developed (see https://forge.easysdi.org/issues/642) but haven't been applied to all easySDI objects.

Such objects should be updated as well:
* layer (MAP)
* perimeter (SHOP)
* property (SHOP)

details.new_value:
New access scope "Organism's category" has been developed (see https://forge.easysdi.org/issues/642) but haven't been applied to all easySDI objects.

Such objects should be setted up and implemented as well:
* layer (MAP) in backoffice
* perimeter (SHOP) in backoffice
* property (SHOP) in backoffice

Such objects should be implemented as they can already be setted up
* visualization (MAP) in frontoffice
* diffusion (CATALOG) in frontoffice

I hope other easySDI objects haven't been forgotten...

journals.notes: I checked the various objects in backend and I do not see any others so far which should use "organism's category" access scope.

Goal would be to remove Joomla acces rules on easySDI objects and replace them with easySDI access rules if missing.
A first analysis should be done before implementing such change...

Technical Committee vote for such change.
Everyone also agree that organism's category restriction should be applied on all easySDI objects.
